column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Esono Mbengono (Equatorial Guinea) (spoke in Spanish): At the outset, I would like to congratulate\r
#Text=South Africa on its successful presidency in October and\r
#Text=on the Council's adoption of resolution 2439 (2019), on\r
#Text=women and peace and security.
#Text=We wish the delegation\r
#Text=of the United Kingdom a productive presidency and\r
#Text=would like to assure it of Equatorial Guinea's steadfast\r
#Text=collaboration and support.
#Text=My thanks also go to the two\r
#Text=briefers, my sisters Deputy Secretary-General Amina\r
#Text=Mohammed and Ms.
#Text=Fatima Kyari Mohammed, for\r
#Text=their informative statements.
#Text=We join others in commemorating the tenth\r
#Text=anniversary of the establishment of the mandate of the\r
#Text=Office of the Special Representative of the Secretary\r
#Text=General on Conflict-Related Sexual Violence.
#Text=Our\r
#Text=Government will continue to support the various\r
#Text=elements of the United Nations architecture aimed\r
#Text=at combating sexual violence in armed conflicts, the\r
#Text=promotion of women's rights and the inclusion of\r
#Text=women in decision-making processes.
#Text=The Republic of Equatorial Guinea believes that the\r
#Text=enhanced cooperation between the Security Council\r
#Text=and the African Union's African Peace and Security\r
#Text=Architecture, which also strengthens subregional\r
#Text=initiatives in the implementation of Council resolutions\r
#Text=to advance the women and peace and security agenda,\r
#Text=among other things, is an example of the type of\r
#Text=alliance that should continue to be supported in a\r
#Text=more predictable manner.
#Text=In that regard, we would\r
#Text=like to highlight the high-level visits led by the Deputy\r
#Text=Secretary-General to the Democratic Republic of\r
#Text=the Congo and Nigeria in 2017, the Niger, the Sahel,\r
#Text=South Sudan and Afghanistan in 2018, and to Ethiopia,\r
#Text=Djibouti, Somalia and Eritrea this year, not forgetting\r
#Text=the visit to Cameroon in April.
#Text=I would also like to\r
#Text=acknowledge the dedication of the Office of the Special\r
#Text=Representative of the Secretary-General on Sexual\r
#Text=Violence in Conflict to mainstreaming this agenda,\r
#Text=while also encouraging the strategic initiatives within\r
#Text=the Joint United Nations-African Union Framework for\r
#Text=Enhanced Partnership in Peace and Security concerning\r
#Text=the prevention of and response to conflict-related\r
#Text=sexual violence in Africa, bolstered by the support of\r
#Text=UN-Women, the African Women Leaders Network and\r
#Text=FemWise-Africa.
#Text=The strategic importance of the Horn of Africa and\r
#Text=the generally positive evolution of events in the region\r
#Text=made ajoint visit of the United Nations and the African\r
#Text=Union more than necessary.
#Text=These visits are becoming\r
#Text=something of a tradition for the two institutions, which\r
#Text=complement one another in the quest for solutions to\r
#Text=issues affecting life on the African continent.
#Text=Equatorial\r
#Text=Guinea has always applauded the cooperation between\r
#Text=the two organizations in Africa, given that their\r
#Text=partnership is a valid formula that is bound to have\r
#Text=positive results.
#Text=The promotion of the women and peace\r
#Text=and security agenda must continue to be united in its\r
#Text=criteria and actions with a View to making more room\r
#Text=for women at the negotiating and decision-making\r
#Text=tables and benefiting from their unique perspective.
#Text=Only in this way, and with the support of subregional\r
#Text=institutions such as the Intergovernmental Authority on\r
#Text=Development, will it be possible to make progress in\r
#Text=terms of conflict resolution and peacebuilding in the\r
#Text=subregion and throughout the continent.
#Text=The participation of women in the quest for\r
#Text=solutions to the problems affecting the region should\r
#Text=be encouraged.
#Text=Women, together with young people,\r
#Text=must be at the heart of those efforts in order to forge\r
#Text=sustainable peace and development and seek out\r
#Text=lasting solutions in a context of humanitarian crisis.
#Text=And women must always play a principal role in post-\r
#Text=conflict situations.
